key_title: Key to the species of Myoporum

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the genera of Myoporaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Myoporaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Myoporaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plant low growing, prostrate, procumbent or decumbent, mat-like, less than 30 cm high; leaves less than 30 mm long
Plant spreading to erect, mostly more than 50 cm high; leaves usually more than 30 mm long (except M. brevipes)
Leaves usually more than 2 mm wide, not lax; flowers not noticeably secund; ovary rounded or pointed at apex; western, northern or coastal areas
Leaves narrow-linear, mostly less than 2 mm wide, lax; flowers secund on upper side of branches; ovary truncate at apex; dry, rocky areas of the east (upper catchment of the Snowy River)
Fruit more or less globose, obtuse, fleshy; sepals more or less ovate, more than 1 mm long; shrubs
Fruit ovate, compressed, acute, dry; sepals triangular, to c. 1 mm long; north-west; often small trees
Leaves more than 1 cm wide, toothed or if entire then plants coastal and thick-leaved
Leaves usually less than 1 cm wide, usually entire; inland areas
Leaves entire or bluntly toothed, hardly sticky; stamens included; drupe c. 8 mm diam
Leaves finely toothed, very sticky; stamens exserted; drupe c. 5 mm diam
Leaves often tuberculate on both surfaces; corolla 4–6 mm long
Leaves not tuberculate; corolla 6–8 mm long
